Articles.Content: Life?

Life?

Nope

From forests, from swamps, from deep underground,

I can make your emotions go swinging around.

Many enjoy me, and others employ me,

There's always a new form to be found.

I can be made in the moment, or follow a plan;

The best is laid out in code.

By one can be poignant, by many is grand,

I exist in many a mode.

What am I?
Is it music?
Or a book maybe? (Story? Or perhaps, a riddle?)
Metal?

Is it music?

Bah! That was too quick, figures cantab would get it. I kind of figured I had a giveaway in there. Anyone need an explanation?

Anyone need an explanation?

Please. Not sure how music comes from swamps or deep underground.

Please. Not sure how music comes from swamps or deep underground.

Agreed.
I think he's referring to the mood. Or perhaps where artists get inspiration.

From forests, from swamps, from deep underground,

---- Wood instruments from the forests, reed instruments from the swamps, brass instruments (and metal guitar strings) from mines. Served well as a misdirection, but apparently cantab wasn't fooled

I can make your emotions go swinging around.---- self explanatory

Many enjoy me, and others employ me, ---- Most people enjoy music, ad agencies use it to sell, movies/TV use it to set mood

There's always a new form to be found. ----- Classical, R&B, jazz, rock, rap, hip-hop.... what's the next new hot sound?

I can be made in the moment, or follow a plan; ----- Improvising and jamming, or played from a music sheet

The best is laid out in code. ----- The best jam sessions end up written down as a musical score

By one can be poignant, by many is grand, ----- Solos can be tear-jerkers, while a full orchestra is quite the rich, grand experience

I exist in many a mode.---- Live, recorded on wax cylinders, phonograph, tape, CD

What am I?

Edited March 7, 2015 by StrandedonEarth

Oh. Oh, that's clever.

Well, onwards to the next one, I suppose.
Thanks, but apparently not clever enough. I guess I needed to obfuscate one more line

I wondered if the first line was referring to natural musical sounds. And the penultimate I took to be a reference to musical modes, a type of scale.

Anyway, I'm lacking ideas myself, so I'll open the floor.

I've got one.

I am the thing

that makes the light that you can't see

So that the thing

that makes the light you *can* see

will make the light

that you want to see.

I am...?
Heat or (electrical) current?

Heat or (electrical) current?

Newp. I'm kinda relieved that you didn't get it on the first guess...

Best,

-Slashy

Electromagnetic pulses?

(Or a battery? Specifically, a Lithium battery?)

Edited March 9, 2015 by Xannari Ferrows
X-ray?
Is it tritium?

Nope, nope, and nope.

Best,

-Slashy
Power generation?
A fluorescent light bulb?
Phosphorescence?
An MRI scanner.
Opportunity?
